data.title: They don't even deserve a 1 rating/Lack of community spirit!
data.text:
My husband and I were volunteering at the start of the Amgen Tour of California stage in Lodi.  Our booth was in need of tap water to make coffee for some of the sponsors who made the event possible.  The owner told my husband he had to pay for the water.  He went over to McKinley's Frame Shop across the street and Julie McKinley, the owner, graciously offered up bottled water at no charge!  

This business lacks community spirit!  Clayton at School Grounds Coffee on School Street, just 1 block south supports many community activities and makes great coffee drinks!

data.title: Best salads!
data.text: This is a great place to pick up a snack, coffee, or lunch - great salads and sandwiches!  Located downtown Lodi

data.title: Breakfast Downtown Lodi
data.text: Tillies is about the only place in downtown Lodi to get a hot breakfast. There were 7 of us, we all had something different,  The quiche was good, muffins were also very good.  The staff is friendly and helpful.  I have had lunch here but this is the first time for breakfast.  We will go back again. Its a nice friendly place to relax and enjoy a good cup of coffee.

data.title: Nope!
data.text: It is so cute with the little outside tables, but $10 for 1/2 sandwich, drink and potato salad seems expensive.  Especially since the avocado that u add, is more like the bagged frozen crappy guacamole mix.  This made my turkey sandwich very disappointing, I mean really, it it pretty hard to mess up a turkey sandwich

data.title: Good food, good prices, easy access.
data.text: I love Tillie's, they have a variety of breakfast and lunch items. They have a large eating area you can relax and eat and visit, no rush. nice folks too!

data.title: Friendly staff and cheerful cafe
data.text: I was in Lodi for the Tour of California bike race and desperately needed a soda. I couldn't resist the pumpkin pie. It was good except the crust. The staff was so friendly and chatty. And the interior is cheerful and clean so I am staying for a while... sandwiches are tempting.

data.title: Best Breakfast Spot in Lodi
data.text: Tillie's is a wonderful spot with very attentive staff.  The establishment is nestled away in downtown Lodi just steps way from the busy business community.  Their numerous coffee selections will start your travel or business day.  I often meet business associates there to discuss upcoming or on-going projects in their peaceful environment.  You miss Tillie's you miss Lodi

data.title: Excellent Coffee and Surprisingly Good Lunches
data.text:
I have been a customer of Tillie's since it opened 16 years ago. Feel like Norm when I walk in there. Aurora and Kim, the two ladies who are the morning crew, are wonderful, and take the time to ensure all customers feel welcome and are taken care of. Coffee prices are reasonable and their homemade scones are outstanding.

Lunches are also very good. I like the Sunburst Salad. Outstanding. 

The original owner, Tillie, sold her shop last year, but the new owner's have kept about everything the same. That is good as some old farts like me like it that way!!!

data.title: Homey & great for a "coffee rest"
data.text: Billed as a Coffee & Tea place it is much more. They have great pastries and sandwiches. The coffee choices rival Starbucks but the "down home " atmosphere is much more comfortable. We had their soup of the day...clam chowder. Probably amongst the best I've had since visiting New England.

data.title: Great place to meet & eat
data.text:
Tillie's is such a nice spot to meet for lunch or coffee and a good visit with friends. The atmosphere is a great blend of comfortable and fun. The menu sandwich and the made-to-order options will satisfy a big appetite. The salads are marvelous. I tell myself I'll try a different one but every time I order the Mandarin Chicken. I could bathe in the Asian dressing and the greens are always so fresh and crunchy!
The homemade desserts are perfect if you're meeting for coffee or have any room left after lunch. The lemon bar is divine! The staff is friendly and helpful offering options not seen on the menu.
 Tillie's is a great place to break from wandering all the fun places in downtown Lodi.

data.title: nice for meeting friends
data.text: I haven't had lunch there, but their bkfst. choices are slim if that's what you want. The coffee is decent, and they are super accommodating with making it just the way you like it. Staff is friendly, the surroundings comfy.

data.title: Simple et bon
data.text:
Nous y sommes allé le midi, le personnel est adorable ! Les sandwichs sont un peu cher pour ce que c'est, mais il y a pas mal de choix et vous pouvez créer votre propre sandwich avec choix de pain et condiments.
J'ai pris un veggie bagel, la encore on peut choisir le choix du pain. C'était très bon, je regrette que pour les végétariens ce soit le même prix étant donné qu'il n'y a pas de viande. 
Dommage que la déco ne soit pas très encourageante.
